flawed_nl_solution:
The electronics store sold 327 televisions this Black Friday and might sell 50 more televisions the next year, for a total of 327 + 50 = <<327+50=737>>737 televisions.
The second year they might sell 737 + 50 = <<737+50=787>>787 televisions.
The third year, if they continue to sell 50 more televisions than they did the previous year, they will sell 787 + 50 televisions = <<787+50=837>>837 televisions on the Black Friday three years from now.
#### 837

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 377, not 737. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
